prompt:
Write Python code that defines the following pandas DataFrame representing environmental sensor readings:

import pandas as pd
data = {
    "Timestamp": ["2025-05-24 10:00", "2025-05-24 10:05", "2025-05-24 10:10", "2025-05-24 10:15", "2025-05-24 10:00", "2025-05-24 10:05"],
    "SensorID": ["S1", "S1", "S1", "S1", "S2", "S2"],
    "TemperatureCelsius": [22.5, 22.7, 22.6, 22.8, 21.9, 22.0],
    "HumidityPercent": [55, 56, 55, 57, 60, 59],
    "AirQualityIndex": [30, 32, 31, 33, 25, 26]
}
df = pd.DataFrame(data)

After creating the DataFrame, the code should: 1) Find and print the maximum "TemperatureCelsius" recorded across all sensors. 2) Find and print the minimum "HumidityPercent" recorded across all sensors. Provide only Python code.
evaluation_criteria: Code should correctly define the DataFrame and accurately find and print the maximum temperature and minimum humidity.
